title: How to Make Lemon Salt

steps.headline: Measure 1 cup of lemon juice, and 2 tablespoons of salt together in a small bowl.
Place the lemon juice and salt in a pan and boil.
steps.description: After about 2 minutes of boiling, a white/yellow crusty substance will start to form and float on the top.

steps.headline: Scrape off the crust with a spoon.
Place the crust in a clean bowl.
Continue to boil.
steps.description: Once again, stop and scrape off the crust.

steps.headline: Keep the process going.
steps.description: After a while, there will be nothing left, except for the crust.

steps.headline: Drain all of the juice from the crust.
steps.description: Let it dry on a paper towel.

steps.headline: Put the crust, now dry, in a small container.
Eat little by little, or save to put on top of flavorless crackers.
steps.description: It can also be used in your cooking, where you need a salty and lemony flavor at the same time.
